text:
Hello, I could someone maybe tell me how exactly the DND area for the blogposts works? does this only work with `{{ content.post_body }}`  or also with the regular

`{% dnd_area 'content', class='main' %}`
`{% end_dnd_area %}`

I want to have the content and under the body to be able to drag more modules inside of the blog.

I have a question about Webhooks - is it possible to listen for ANY contact field to be updated? Or do I have to listen to only specific fields?
Hi i want to hide this header is there any way :

Hi HubSpot enthusiasts,
Does anybody know if I can create a custom regex validation for a form field?

I see that I can limit a property format to numbers only, and I know I can write a script to do the validation manually, but I was wondering if there is a built-in method. Thanks.
Is there a relationship between a deal and a contact or must this be made manually? What field?
It’s not really a field, it’s called an association. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
When you create a deal in the crm at the bottom of the deal creation tab it will show something like this:
so, I have to create a custom field, right?

If you are associating native objects there are already predefined association types between them, such as deal to contact, deal to company, etc. You can set and retrieve assocations by object type(s) / object id(s). I don’t think creating a custom field would achieve anything other than a massive headache in the future.
And if you are using custom objects you can define associations types to the native HubSpot objects
